ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
1= Acute (Less than or equal to 12 months); 2= Sub-acute (13-24 months); 3= Chronic (Greater than 24 months)

ElementDescription: Maudsley Staging Model (MSM) - Symptom severity (at baseline)
Notes: 1= Subsyndromal; 2= Mild; 3= Moderate; 4= Severe without psychosis; 5= Severe with psychosis

ElementDescription: Maudsley Staging Model (MSM) - Treatment Failures - Antidepressants
Notes: 1= Level 1: 1-2 medications; 2= Level 2: 3-4 medications; 3= Level 3: 5-6 medications; 4= Level 4: 7-10 medications; 5= Level 5: Greater than 10 medications

ElementDescription: Maudsley Staging Model (MSM) - Treatment Failures - Augmentation
Maudsley Staging Model (MSM) - Treatment Failures - Electroconvulsive Therapy (ECT)

Notes: 0= Failure of any medication trial to be adequate; 1= Stage 1: Failure of at least 1 adequate trial of major class of antidepressants (ADs); 2= Stage 2: Failure of at least 2 adequate trial of 2 distinct classes of ADs; 3= Stage 3: Stage 2 plus failure of an adequate trial with a Tricyclic antidepressants (TCA); 4= Stage 4: Stage 3 plus failure of an adequate trial with an MAOI (Monoamine oxidase inhibitor); 5= Stage 5: Stage 4 plus a course of bilateral electroconvulsive therapy (ECT)
